page.title: 12EDUCATION
page.content: Education in Belper was reorganised 11 years ago,to a three tier non_selective scheme with first 5_9, middle 9_13 and high 13+ schools. Included in the Belper system were 4 village schools.Hazelwood has 30 children and will close in 1986 as will Fleet,when Belper Education is again reorganised into{Nursery}3_5, {primary}4_11 and{Secondary {Comprehensive and Further Education. The{Roman Catholic School}is an anomally in that it has remained a 5_11 primary school throughout both reorganisations. The schools vary in character from Victorian stone or brick buildings to modern open plan units. There are 900 at secondary,300 at each town primary and less than 50 children in the village schools.
